private_information: I can only manipulate vowel-labeled blocks: A E I
I can only pick or place one top block at a time
I can only interact with blocks that are currently at the top of a stack
vowel_agent.goal: Contribute to achieving the target stacked configuration by manipulating vowel blocks according to my capabilities

private_information: I can only manipulate consonant-labeled blocks: B C D F G H J K L
I can only pick or place one top block at a time
I can only interact with blocks that are currently at the top of a stack
consonant_agent.goal: Contribute to achieving the target stacked configuration by manipulating consonant blocks according to my capabilities

private_information: I coordinate the two agents and must produce a single FastDownwards-compatible PDDL domain and PDDL problem that encodes the full multi-agent constraints
I must keep actions of the two agents distinct in the PDDL by labeling actions with agent-specific names or prefixes
orchestrator.goal: Produce a FastDownwards-compatible PDDL domain and problem that achieves the global target block configuration while respecting each agent's manipulation limitations

public_information: There are twelve uniquely labeled blocks: A B C D E F G H I J K L

Initial stacks are as follows: Stack 1 bottom G with A on top. Stack 2 bottom D with K on top of D, E on top of K, J on top of E, and I on top of J. Stack 3 bottom B with H on top of B, C on top of H, and L on top of C. Stack 4 bottom F on the table alone.
Only top blocks of each stack can be picked up or moved at any time
Each agent can manipulate only one block at a time
One agent is restricted to vowels and the other to consonants as specified in their private information
The global target configuration is a single descending stack with L on the table, K on L, J on K, I on J, H on I, G on H, F on G, E on F, D on E, C on D, B on C, and A on B

observe.system_prompt: You are an observer and actor restricted to vowel blocks. Report which vowel blocks are currently at the top of each stack and any relevant local constraints you perceive. Do not produce PDDL. Provide a concise structured description of the top-of-stack vowels, their stack identifiers, and any immediate moves you can perform given your private information and the public initial configuration.
observe.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. You have the public information about the blocks and the initial stacks as provided by the environment public_information. You have the following private constraints: you can only move vowels A E I, you can only move top blocks, and you can move only one block at a time. Your goal is to contribute to the global rearrangement. Produce a clear structured report of which vowel blocks are currently accessible at the top of stacks, where they are, and what single-block moves you are capable of performing from the current state.

observe.system_prompt: You are an observer and actor restricted to consonant blocks. Report which consonant blocks are currently at the top of each stack and any relevant local constraints you perceive. Do not produce PDDL. Provide a concise structured description of the top-of-stack consonants, their stack identifiers, and any immediate moves you can perform given your private information and the public initial configuration.
observe.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. You have the public information about the blocks and the initial stacks as provided by the environment public_information. You have the following private constraints: you can only move consonants B C D F G H J K L, you can only move top blocks, and you can move only one block at a time. Your goal is to contribute to the global rearrangement. Produce a clear structured report of which consonant blocks are currently accessible at the top of stacks, where they are, and what single-block moves you are capable of performing from the current state.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator responsible for producing a final PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that are directly usable by the FastDownwards planner. Encode the multi-agent constraints explicitly. Keep agent actions distinct by prefixing or otherwise naming actions according to the agent that can perform them. The domain must reflect that only top blocks can be moved, that agents can move only one block at a time, that vowel_agent can move only vowel blocks and consonant_agent can move only consonant blocks, and that the goal is the specified final stacked configuration. Provide both the domain and the problem. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Use FastDownwards-compatible constructs and include any required :requirements. Do not rely on information not present in the public information or the agents' observations. If some details are missing, state them explicitly and encode the parts you can.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. You will receive the structured reports from vowel_agent and consonant_agent named vowel_knowledge and consonant_knowledge. Integrate these reports with the public initial configuration and produce a FastDownwards-compatible PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that, when solved, yields a plan that respects the per-agent manipulation constraints and achieves the global target configuration. Keep actions of the two agents distinct and named accordingly. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
